pull.title: Correct description of blocksdir default value
pull.body: I recently moved all my Bitcoin datadir except blocksdir from a slow storage to the fast one. By previous description of blocksdir default I expected that blocksdir value should be "old_datadir/blocks", but it actually should be "old_datadir", as it expects / creates "blocks" subdirectory under it, so it's default is actually `<datadir>`, not `<datadir>/blocks`. See also `GetDataDir()` in `src/util/system.cpp`.

events.message: Correct description of blocksdir default value

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15457](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15457.html) (Check std::system for -[alert|block|wallet]notify by Sjors)
* [#14364](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14364.html) (doc: Clarify -blocksdir usage by sangaman)
* [#12557](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/12557.html) ([WIP] 64 bit iOS device support by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
From https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/e79bbb73e08e3f191e97d3b67a2fbb510c5545ff/src/util/system.cpp#L724-L735 looks like the default is correct?
I'm not saying default is not correct, I am saying it's current description in help is a lie.

Oh right! ~~Didn't check history but is current behavior correct? I mean, is it normal to expect subdirectory `blocks/` on the specified `-blocksdir`?~~

Edit: see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/12828#issuecomment-408693766

I think the help should say something like `Specify root directory for blocks (*blk) and undo (*.rev) files (default: <datadir>)`.
#14364 got merged (noticed existence of such PR only after pushing this one), this isn't actual anymore.

comments.body:
Should this put `blocks` into some quotes to clarify this is a string literal and not a English word (that e.g. can be translated). Thankfully we no longer translate those, but could still make it clear?

```suggestion
    gArgs.AddArg("-blocksdir=<dir>", "Specify 'blocks' directory (default: <datadir>)", false, OptionsCategory::OPTIONS);
```
